Articles.Content:
I am not sure if this is one of my mods or KSP core memory leak but I am fair sure it is a memory leak.

Here are my system specs:

 ![LyuYy0x.png](%5Bimg%5Dhttp%3A//i.imgur.com/LyuYy0x.png)

[Here is the link to my crash reports](https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B27A074CVw4yTVdCTHRTdmhGdTQ&usp=sharing)

Here is what my Gamedata folder looks like:

![5ryaSE9.png](%5Bimg%5Dhttp%3A//i.imgur.com/5ryaSE9.png)

The crashing started as only reverts and switching scenes crashes now I am getting crashes even in mid flight.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-02T21:05:50Z" title="05/02/2015 09:05  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 2, 2015</time> by mcirish3**
  
Corrected link to error logs

the only thing you and I have in common is ATM installed. I also have to report I have CTD's periodically for no reason. It started for me as trying to launch a vessel and just now when switching to a stranded Kerbal for rescue. Here is a picture of my gamedata folder. Umbra has EXPpack, FTT, Karbonite, K+, Kolonization, sounding rockets, and surv pack installed.

![Screenshot%202015-05-02%2018.53.25.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/s3wff6wii7hjdf5/Screenshot%202015-05-02%2018.53.25.png?dl=0). Since the URL isn't working, here's a pic of mod folder: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/s3wff6wii7hjdf5/Screenshot%202015-05-02%2018.53.25.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/s3wff6wii7hjdf5/Screenshot%202015-05-02%2018.53.25.png?dl=0)
So The bug is probably, but not necessarily, related to Core KSP or to the latest version of ATM. May narrow things down a bit.
ok, it looks a bit to me like you have too many mods installed, KSP for windows is now x86 only, so it can only use 3.5 gb of your RAM. Also, why are you running X64 with only 4 gb of RAM?

> 
> ok, it looks a bit to me like you have too many mods installed, KSP for windows is now x86 only, so it can only use 3.5 gb of your RAM. Also, why are you running X64 with only 4 gb of RAM?

You would be surprised at what can be loaded with ATM at the lowest possible resolution and be under the limit.
